description: Number of level partitions of n.
comments: A partition is level if the powers of 2 dividing its parts are all equal.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1,     `if`(i<1, 0, add(b(n-i*j, i-p, p), j=0..n/i)))    end:a:= n-> (m-> `if`(n=0, 1, add(b(n, (h-> h-1+irem(h, 2)    )(iquo(n, 2^j))*2^j, 2^(1+j)), j=0..m)))(ilog2(n)):seq(a(n), n=0..60);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 11 2015
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[ PartitionsQ[n/2^k], {k, 0, IntegerExponent[n, 2]}]; Table[ a[n], {n, 1, 55}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 12 2011, after Vladeta Jovovic *)
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 02 2000
extensions: a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 11 2015
